topic.title: Trash Folder
topic.p: Whenever a message is deleted from any other folder, it is sent to the Trash folder. This feature provides a second opportunity to decide if you want to permanently delete the message.
Caution: When you empty the Trash folder, the messages in it are eliminated and cannot be recovered.

ol.title: To empty the Trash folder:

li.p: In the Folder Management menu group, click Folder List (expand the menu group to see the links, if necessary).

ol.li:
Click clear for the Trash folder.
Caution: No message appears asking if you are sure you want to delete these messages.
A message appears informing you that the Trash folder has been cleared.

ol.title: To recover messages that are in the Trash folder:

li.p: In the Mail Folders menu group, click Trash (expand the menu group to see the links, if necessary).

ol.li:
Select the check boxes for the messages you want to keep and move to another folder (or select the top check box to select all messages).
Note: If the Trash folder contains more than one page of messages, only the currently displayed messages are checked when the top check box is selected.
Click the down-arrow in the Move Message(s) to drop-down list, and select the folder where you want to move the messages.
Click Move. A message appears informing you that your messages have been moved.
